quizData.question: These are files that contain compiled code targeted at the .NET Framework.
These are basically physical packages meant for distributing code
Which is NOT TRUE  about the assemblies
quizData.answer: They are giving a strong, unique name based on the private key cryptography to avoid name collision
choices: These are files that contain compiled code targeted at the .NET Framework.
These are basically physical packages meant for distributing code
The .NET classes are actually contained in several assemblies
They are giving a strong, unique name based on the private key cryptography to avoid name collision

quizData.question: These are two sections of an assembly.
These are two file extensions of an assembly.
It includes information about the data types of the program that are being used.
It holds the information of the assembly, which consists of the name, version number, and the type of mapping information.
It is for standalone applications.
It is for reusable components.
.NET Frameworksâ€™ core assemblies location can be found in _____.
It is the simplest type of assembly
It can only be used within a software package that is intended to be used.
It does not require registry entries
Two assemblies with the same class name are not a problem since the application can only see the classes that are mentioned in its assemblies
These are libraries that other applications can commonly use.
Security precautions are necessary when using this assembly since any other software can access an assembly.
It is a common problem in shared assembly wherein other classes or variables have the same name that matches with the other shared assembly
A different form of the same assembly might overwrite the shared assembly, and the new version might be incompatible with the existing code.
Shared assemblies are giving a strong, unique name based on the private key cryptography to avoid name collision.
It enables several applications to share shared assembly.
It is required to add the assembly to the special directory.
It is a centralized storage location for .NET Assemblies.

Which step specifies the statement?
Create a project containing a class file. The class file contains the methods and properties that you want other applications to access.

Which step specifies the statement?
Generate a strong name for the project. The strong name is saved in a strong key filename. The strong key file is created named ShareAssemblyMessageKeyFile.snk and located at the solutions explorer.

Which step specifies the statement?
Specify the key filename in the project by indicating its strong key filename in the AssemblyInfo.cs file.

Which step specifies the statement?
Compile the project to generate an assembly. The assembly is generated with the extension .dll.
Which is not a step in creating a shared assembly?
quizData.answer: Create a project containing a stream file. The class file contains the methods and properties that you want other applications to access.
choices: Create a project containing a stream file. The class file contains the methods and properties that you want other applications to access.

Generate a strong name for the project. The strong name is saved in a strong key filename. The strong key file is created named ShareAssemblyMessageKeyFile.snk and
located at the solutions explorer
Specify the key filename in the project by indicating its strong key filename in the AssemblyInfo.cs file
Compile the project to generate an assembly. The assembly is generated with the extension .dll
